results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, Mike Crisp and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Two versions of an item about a factory that has introduced morning exercises for its workers. Shows how the same material can be edited in different ways to change the shape of the story. There is also a demonstration of how interviews can be edited to greatest advantage and how shots can be juxtaposed to make the best use of materials.

results.title: Edith Piaf
results.creator_credit: Peter Graham, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary on the life of the famous French singer. Highlights the pressures undergone by entertainers, such as the constant travel, drugs and alcohol and media attention. Narrated by Alan Badel

results.title: Edge of the outback
results.creator_credit: Stefan Sargent and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A picture of the life in the region of Longreach, Queensland, at the time of the annual Agricultural Show in a drought season. Without explicit commentary we candidly observe a grazier and his family over several days while they go about their family, business and social life

results.title: Edge of the deep
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Peter Bruce and Boolari Films
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the way of life on the sea shore. Many birds such as gulls, pelicans, swans and cormorants are shown and their adaptations to the tidal pattern explained. Migratory and breeding habits of other species are discussed. This poetic film of bird life is centred round two derelict barges which locate the scene and establish the continuity of the movements of the tide.

results.title: Eden
results.brief_description: Eden is an old growth forest in the Mount Kosciusko region of N.S.W.’s South-East that is still being logged today. Benjamin Cruse, the narator and member of Eden Land Council, tells of the efforts being made to save the remainder of the forest from total devastation. An Aboriginal man whose ancestors belonged to the region, Cruz describes the logging companies attitude towards the land as being connected and the same to the attitude of the ‘settlers’ toward indigenous people. The Aboriginal relationship with the land in Australia is described as being the ‘original human relationship’, the land is where the spirit is born and returns to upon death.
